# Draft:Edward Nana Yaw Koranteng

Edward Koranteng is a lawyer and an experienced corporate and investment banker with over 25 years working experience. He held the position of the Chief Executive Officer of the Minerals Income Investment Fund “MIIF”, Ghana and Africa’s first publicly owned sovereign minerals wealth fund from 2021 until January 2025. As CEO of MIIF, he oversaw the management of Government of Ghana’s equity interest in mining companies and managed all royalties paid to the state from mining activities. Under his tenure as CEO of MIIF, the Fund grew its assets under management from $195 Million to over $1.5 Billion in three years and in 2023 grew the Fund’s profits by 100% in 2023 and quadrupled it in 2024.
Mr Koranteng’s working career started as a management consultant for PricewaterhouseCoopers in 1999. Prior to his appointment to MIIF, he was the Business Head for East, Central and Southern Africa for Ghana International Bank plc (GHIB) in the United Kingdom, and was stationed primarily in Nairobi, Kenya where he led various financing projects in Ethiopia, Tanzania, Kenya and Malawi. Edward Koranteng saw to the successful development of a funding structure for the Reserve Bank of Malawi to support Malawi’s dollar reserves. He also worked on secondary participations with Credit Suisse to provide budgetary support for the Government of Tanzania, development of a funding structure with Trade Development Bank Africa (TDB) to support the Commercial Bank of Ethiopia on essential commodities for the Government of Ethiopia, led the restructuring of a long-term facility with other DFIs, including the European Investment Bank for the pan-African housing entity, Shelter Afrique, and facilitated medium-term financing for a number of banks in the region including HFC Bank Kenya.
Koranteng also worked with the Chase Bank Group (Kenya), now SBM Bank Mauritius, and its investment banking subsidiary Genghis Capital as Group Head for energy, oil, gas and mining including renewable energy. Before joining Chase Bank, he was the Group Head responsible for energy/oil and gas and mining for Fidelity Bank (Ghana) Ltd in Accra. Prior to Fidelity, he had worked at Access Bank Ghana as Group Head of Corporate and Institutional Banking. His banking career however started with Ecobank Ghana Ltd in the year 2000 where he held various managerial roles at the bank for ten years and pioneered the bank’s mining business in 2002.
Edward holds a BA (Hons) from the University of Ghana, a Master of Laws LLM in International Banking and Finance from the University of Leeds in the UK, PGDip from BPP Law School in the UK and called to the Bar as a Barrister at Law at Lincoln’s Inn in the UK and subsequently as a Barrister and Solicitor in Ghana with the Ghana School of Law. He holds various executive certifications including that from Wharton Business School (University of Pennsylvania) and on Oil, Gas and Mining from the Blavatnik School of Government, University of Oxford. Edward was CEO of the year in Ghana in 2023 and 2024 for minerals investments and CEO of the year for 2023/24 for the minerals sector.  He serves on the Boards of Glico General Insurance, Canadian and Frankfurt listed Asante Gold Corporation, the Credit Referencing Agency of Ghana where he serves as the Chairman and until recently on the Board of Atlantic Lithium of Australia.
